column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=AMD :
#Text=I had the immense joy of working a lot of time and also living over there , and for me it was the discovery of an immense culture , well beyond what I could have imagined .
#Text=It was an encounter with a people , the Turkish people , whom we do n't make the effort to know in depth .
#Text=Most of the time there are too many clichés that are in no way reflections of what these people truly are ...
#Text=I am not talking about the leaders , I 'm talking about the citizens of a country .
#Text=I learned about them , to understand them , to exchange with them , in all their diversity , and God knows that in matters of diversity
#Text=Turkey knows what it 's talking about .
#Text=I spent rare moments there surrounded by Turks , Armenians , Greeks , and Jews sitting at the same table and speaking the same language , the language of love and friendship ...
#Text=In all the whole world it 's the same thing .
#Text=All is well except when politics or religion intervene .
#Text=Eurovision ' 79

#Text=( ( MH ) ) In 1979 , you decided to compete for a spot at the Eurovision final again , this time for France . Why did you want to go back a second time ? Considering your past success , were you fairly confident that you would end up being the French representative that year ?

#Text=AMD : It was a taste for risk that guided me , but a measured risk , because ' Winner of the Grand Eurovision Prize 1973 ' is a lifetime title that one does not risk losing if one takes another chance .
#Text=The place [ you received ] remains [ that ] place .
#Text=When I accepted [ the opportunity ] to try representing France in 1979 , I knew that the rules of the game were different than the ones in Luxembourg .
#Text=Winner [ from ] 1973 or not , it did n't change [ things ] much since one needed to pass through a selection process .
#Text=I played the game like everyone else and it was the public who voted for the 12 semi-finalists .
#Text=Unfortunately television was on strike , and the finale could not be held as planned .
#Text=The 12 semi-finalists were therefore viewed by a jury of professionals , and I was retained .
#Text=But I respected the rule all the way to the end , and above all French television never modified the rule until the final candidate selection .

#Text=I would have appreciated that France 3 [ Editor 's note : The current television station broadcasting Eurovision in France ] respects the rule of the game the same way this year ... and that all the candidates win or lose in loyal fashion , by respecting the rule .

#Text=This will not be the case and I regret that ... [ Editor 's note : After decades of public voting to select France 's finalist , France 3 selected their artist internally this year despite originally calling for finalists . ]
